attributes.action: stop super cars racing up and down Middleton road in banbury day and night
attributes.additional_details: because TVP cant do it and highways dont seem to care and one of these days someone is going to seriously get hurt or maybe killed
attributes.background: to give the council enough funds to have two speed cameras put on Middleton road

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local traffic enforcement are a matter for your local authority and local police force, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
